title: Desktop Task Mining Analysis - Loan Processing Operations
description: Summary analysis of desktop task mining data collected from 3 senior processors over a 2-week observation period. Data captured application usage patterns, context switching frequency, and time allocation across systems.

Microsoft Excel.finding: SHADOW_PROCESS - 14.2% of processor time spent in Excel on unofficial tracking

context_switching.finding: HIGH_FRAGMENTATION - Average task duration of 78 seconds suggests frequent interruptions and context loss

identified_shadow_tools.purpose: Track document expiration dates - workaround for disabled WF-008 alert
identified_shadow_tools.risk: HIGH - Critical compliance data in uncontrolled local file

identified_shadow_tools.purpose: Manual rate lock extension cost calculations
identified_shadow_tools.risk: MEDIUM - Potential for calculation errors; Encompass has built-in feature

shadow_process_analysis.remediation_recommendation: Enable WF-008 stale-doc alert in Encompass; configure rate lock extension workflow

key_findings.finding: Shadow tracking spreadsheet consumes 14.2% of processor time
key_findings.impact: Compliance risk from uncontrolled data; 740 estimated hours/year wasted across team

key_findings.finding: 47 application switches per hour indicates high process fragmentation
key_findings.impact: Increased error rate and cognitive load; estimated 15-20% productivity loss from context switching

key_findings.finding: Manual credit data re-entry from MeridianCredit portal to Encompass
key_findings.impact: Dual data entry for credit supplements; potential for transcription errors

key_findings.finding: Processors use personal calculators for DTI verification instead of Encompass built-in tools
key_findings.impact: Minor efficiency loss; indicates lack of trust in system calculations or inadequate training
